title: Centripetal force - blocks on a platter

content.question: Two small blocks, <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> rotate without slipping on a horizontal disk with Block <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> being twice as far from the rotational axis of the disk as Block <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>. The blocks are made of the same material and Block <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is half the mass of Block <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>. As the disk increases in speed, which block will be the first to begin to slide on the diskâ€™s surface?

choices.label: Block <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is more likely to slide off because it has less mass than Block <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>.

Block <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is more likely to slide off because it moves in a circular path with a greater radius than Block <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>.
